Rik Johnson.title: and long, the storm
Rik Johnson.about:
This album is over 9hrs long. It is a continuous piece broken into 15 tracks due to Bandcamp limitations. There is a theme that winds through it based on a piece I recorded in autumn of 2022 titled "The Storm".
The final mixing and publishing of this album coincides with the biggest snowstorm we've had here (mountains of northern Colorado) in over 4 years. This is a coincidence.
My equipment isn't much compared to other's who do this sort of music. I have several guitars, a bunch of stomp pedals, and a 20yr old Korg CD-RW 4-track mixing board. I master all tracks on an inexpensive computer using free software.
I worked on this for 2 months. I like it.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released March 16, 2024
Rik Johnson - guitars, stomp pedals
tjm/r

Rik Johnson.title: Atishoo, Atishoo
Rik Johnson.about:
As with us mortal men, the laden heart
Is persecuted more, and fever'd more,
When it is nighing to the mournful house
Where other hearts are sick of the same bruise;
So Saturn, as he walk'd into the midst,
Felt faint, and would have sunk among the rest,
But that he met Enceladus's eye,
Whose mightiness, and awe of him, at once
Came like an inspiration; and he shouted,
"Titans, behold your God!" at which some groan'd;
Some started on their feet; some also shouted;
Some wept, some wail'd, all bow'd with reverence;
And Ops, uplifting her black folded veil,
Show'd her pale cheeks, and all her forehead wan,
Her eye-brows thin and jet, and hollow eyes.
-from Hyperion, by John Keats

trackinfo.title: Atishoo, Atishoo

Rik Johnson.title: Bed Of Three
Rik Johnson.about:
up late like the radio;
left on,
humming the static of
almost reception,
waiting to be listened to.
the beer is gone,
smoke is gone,
lights are off
and you are asleep
somewhere
while i sit, tied to my own
consciousness,
unable to turn off,
waiting to be unplugged.
the boxer
untapes,
the security guard
clocks out,
the liar
sneaks inside,
the reader
fades to the dreamer,
the clerk
locks the cooler,
the cop
parks,
the doctor
sighs as
the driver
swerves,
the husband
rolls off,
the wife
gets up to piss,
and the unborn
wait for a miracle.
hum.

Rik Johnson.title: Before The Frame Fell Apart
Rik Johnson.about:
The World is
broken
Every quick blue
sky
is hidden behind
weeks of storm and ruin
There is no repair
and no one
to
claim the wreckage
I have whisky
I have a glass
and half way through
the bottle, I can see how
the
pieces might fit back together
but
I'll probably need
some more ice
In a minute, World.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released May 3, 2021
Rik Johnson, guitar and keyboards.
tjm/r

Rik Johnson.title: Carousel
Rik Johnson.about:
In 1991, I bought an Ensoniq SQ2 synthesizer. With that and a little Tascam 4-track cassette recorder, I put together a lot of experimental nonsense. In 1996, a friend of a friend offered to clean up a few of those recordings and put them on CD. We printed up 50 of them and they sold pretty quickly. This is that collection of songs.
The price of most things goes up, but not music. Not anymore. I sold those CDs for $15 a piece. I'm offering the album plus a bizarre bonus track for the low low price of nothing. Pay what you like or pay nothing.

Rik Johnson.title: Cynosure
Rik Johnson.about:
The female that loves unrequited
sleeps,
And the male that loves unrequited
sleeps,
The head of the money-maker
that plotted all day
sleeps,
And the enraged and treacherous dispositions,
all,
all sleep.
-Walt Whitman

Rik Johnson.title: For Loss
Rik Johnson.about:
The songs of the waves and the hymns of the streams
Are scattered, and the voices of the throngs reduced to silence;
And I can hear naught but the music of eternity
In exact harmony with the spirit's desires.
I am cloaked in full whiteness;
I am in comfort; I am in peace
- Khalil Gibran

Rik Johnson.title: i fucking love you
Rik Johnson.about:
already a memory running for cover,
twisting in pain and desire,
anticipation and a moments freedom,
a lifetime of losing for a day of wishes.
of course this is how it happens.
how could it possibly
have been any different?
it’s perfection within chaos,
heaven within hell.
to hold so closely what you cannot possess,
like a window between a kiss.
this is the thing that drives one to insanity.
it is not war and starvation after all; it’s
following your father down forbidden paths
in full sight of those you wish were blind.
its leaving town for a weekend and
never really being able to come
back home, and if that is the only way
to stop the voices from telling you you’re
fucking up
you’ll do it,
and do it destroying lives,
plundering into fields so filled with
landmines that you know you’ve died
while you’re still running.
my hands are full, my feet are bound;
you are a diamond with butterfly wings.
wish for a story that has no ending.
anything else would send you
reeling with remorse and anger.

Somewhere among the clouds above;
Those that I fight I do not hate,
Those that I guard I do not love;
My country is Kiltartan Cross,
My countrymen Kiltartan's poor,
No likely end could bring them loss
Or leave them happier than before.
Nor law, nor duty bade me fight,
Nor public men, nor cheering crowds,
A lonely impulse of delight
Drove to this tumult in the clouds;
I balanced all, brought all to mind,
The years to come seemed waste of breath,
A waste of breath the years behind
In balance with this life, this death.
-WB Yeats

I lie down in the shadow.
No longer the light of my dream before me,
Above me.
Only the thick wall.
Only the shadow.
My hands!
My dark hands!
Break through the wall!
Find my dream!
Help me to shatter this darkness,
To smash this night,
To break this shadow
Into a thousand lights of sun,
Into a thousand whirling dreams
Of sun!
- Langston Hughes

Rik Johnson.title: Mostly All I C
Rik Johnson.about:
A collection of songs that were recorded with little or no thought on the afternoons & evenings of 4/24 - 4/25, 2020. Every piece is in the key of C, except for the occasional A minor. Same difference. The idea was to create a flow with no measurable bump from track to track.
These pieces were made possible with the extra time allotted me by Covid-19 and the consequential isolation. Thank you, plague.
All proceeds from this album will go to  getusppe.org/donate/#online.

Rik Johnson.title: Mostly All I C At Once
Rik Johnson.about:
In early May I released the album Mostly All I C. It's an album of tracks mostly recorded in the key of C, with a couple in A minor which is of course relative to C. I was listening to this album this morning while running through the mountains and it occurred to me that it might be interesting to play all 9 tracks at once.
And it sort of works, I guess. Track one, the title track from the original album, is the only exception, as it slips into a C minor progression at times. So, I did one mix (track 1 on this album) without it, and another mix (track 5 on this album) with it set towards the end of this longer mix.
Outside of my experimental music, I've spent decades writing and recording a lot of "normal" music. One of my influences since the late 80s has been Bob Mould. "Slowly I Mould" is a nod to him.

Rik Johnson.title: My Imagination
Rik Johnson.about:
In 1982 I moved into an apartment with my girlfriend. I was 18yrs old. I had my music stuff set up in the extra bedroom. I wrote a lot of music at that time, mostly experimental and nothing worth noting. But there was one riff I came up with that I never forgot. I recorded it. In 2014 I messed around with it and put drums and bass to it.Track 1 of this collection begins with the result of that. It then goes to a second part, and then a third. These parts were released as separate tracks on my album With Hands Too Mumbled in 2014. I took the time to remaster them. As a single track, it is intentionally compressed to a point where it is at times uncomfortable.
The remainder of these track were recorded in autumn 2019. They are reflective of where I was during this time.
tjm/r

Rik Johnson.title: Otherwise Without
Rik Johnson.about:
Although you wish it was,
it was never you who broke my heart.
Love set itself in my hands and I
mishandled
and
stumbled
and eventually lost the confidence
of my own
grip,
at which point
Love took a
flying fucking leap.
And as I stood there numb and somehow surprised,
It,
Love,
rather than shatter,
simply kept going until it
was out of view
For that moment alone,
wishing it had not been so fragile,
wishing I had understood fragility,
wishing for anything other than having to face myself alone,
I heard the one,
the only,
the reason you can’t kill me,
every Shakespearean fool,
and the story behind
every fond and familiar
smell,
I watched it go.
◙
Rik Johnson.credits:
released March 16, 2021
All songs written and recorded by Rik Johnson

Rik Johnson.title: Quiet Distance
Rik Johnson.about:
After a deep silence, mingled with sweet dreams, I asked, "Speak to me of that beauty which the people interpret and define, each one according to his own conception; I have seen her honored and worshipped in different ways and manners."
She answered, "Beauty is that which attracts your soul, and that which loves to give and not to receive. When you meet Beauty, you feel that the hands deep within your inner self are stretched forth to bring her into the domain of your heart. It is the magnificence combined of sorrow and joy; it is the Unseen which you see, and the Vague which you understand, and the Mute which you hear - it is the Holy of Holies that begins in yourself and ends vastly beyond your earthly imagination."
- Kahlil Gibran
Five songs; remixes of previously released tracks. Assembled in this collection for relaxation, thought, meditation.

Rik Johnson.title: Reamalgam, Vol 1
Rik Johnson.about:
I record all my music on a Korg D1600 that I bought in 2004, which is a dinosaur piece of equipment. And that's ok and I don't care until the little hard drive inside of it gets full and I have to start deleting songs from previous album projects. That's what I ran into a few weeks ago. Again.
Before clearing the hard drive, I remixed a few of the pieces I did from spring 2017 through winter 2018. With good scotch and strong ales, I took parts of a number of songs, looked at them again, focused on passages and tones that I liked, played with them and came up with these tracks. I'm happy with the results.
I offer my music for free because I have an actual job, and I make music only because I love it. My brain is weird and if I charge anything for it (which I've done) it somehow changes what I do. I prefer just letting it go out to the interwebz. If you care to "donate", that's fine. If not, that's fine too.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released May 12, 2018
All songs written and recorded by me.

Rik Johnson.title: Recover
Rik Johnson.about:
This album is reflection. And brief. Tracks 2, 4 and 5 are new. Tracks 1, 3 and 8 are remixes and edits from recent recordings.Tracks 6 and 7 are from a March 2013 release that got very little attention but I felt deserved another look.
I've said to a few people with whom I'm very close; I make this music for myself, because it's what I want to hear. But it's nice when anyone else listens and enjoys it. Each song, each album, is a soap bubble of goodness I send off to the world and will be there for a very long time. Everyone should do something similar. Put some good out there.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released October 9, 2021
All songs by Rik Johnson
Artwork by Tammy McCrea

Rik Johnson.title: Slip
Rik Johnson.about:
In 2004, I recorded a bunch of songs for my youngest son, Jacob. I have always enjoyed listening to music while I fall asleep and he wanted some music he could listen to while he fell asleep. Listening to these tracks now, I'm sure I failed at providing him soothing music; but the songs are still pretty interesting anyhow.
These are about half the songs I recorded for that album. I really didn't care for the others.

Rik Johnson.title: Sunset And Consequence
Rik Johnson.about:
2013, from late spring through the end of summer, I barely picked up my guitar. Instead, I generally spent my non-working time climbing nearby mountains or resting. During the few evenings I was here, coherent but not necessarily sober, I recorded these songs. Listening to them this evening I've decided I like them and want to share them. Maybe you'll like them, too.
Sunset And Consequence; the end is always the beginning. You already know that.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released September 15, 2013
Album art by KJ Swims

The day after I died
I fell in love
with a woman I was
just getting to know

without intent,
without permission

as much a surprise
to the day after I died
as it was to the day before
It would all
be
so perfect
■∞■

Rik Johnson.title: The Middle Room
Rik Johnson.about:
I didn’t want to wake you
so I closed my ears
and crawled into the phone
and down the line
and back to your house.
The lights were out
and the kitchen still
smelled a bit like spaghetti
and extinguished candles,
like coffee and smoke and
perfume.
I crept to your room and into
your bed, that huge
bed.
I swam around under all
those sheets and blankets
until I found you, still
the same,
naked and wet and warm.
Sleeping, purring, whispering.
I didn’t want to wake you
so I closed my eyes
and slipped into your ear
and into your head
and into your soul
and into your dream.
All the lights
were on
and you sat at the table,
legs crossed
and smiling,
waiting
for me to wake you.

Rik Johnson.title: The Suite Years
Rik Johnson.about:
"I’m just an old man with an electric guitar. You know how that leads you into all kinds of disasters and predicaments. One night I met a very lovely young woman. One thing led to another. I knew she was hungry. She was looking for Kris Kristofferson. I was looking for Brigitte Bardot. But I didn’t know at that time. I pressed on and on. Forever the optimist. Out of that grotesque union, came this song."
- Leonard Cohen

released May 2, 2023
Rik Johnson - music
Tammy Joy McCrea Rogne - artwork

Rik Johnson.title: This Year Will Be Better (2020 Remaster)
Rik Johnson.about:
Almost 8yrs ago I released this album on Bandcamp. It was my first Bandcamp release. It was something I'd thought about for a while and finally put some stuff together and made an album. It features one of my personal favorite original pieces, "Drowned Men Sank Backwards To Sleep".
I've remastered the original tracks and added 3 bonus tracks. It's good stuff and I hope you get something from it, although we all know this year has not been better than any year. In fact it's probably one of the lesser better ones.

Rik Johnson.title: Wait, don't go yet.
Rik Johnson.about:
I've got a photograph
Of you and me out in the front of your parents' house
You're wearing a formal dress
And I'm looking down at the ground
And the sun is at our backs
Two silhouettes frozen in black
Wait. Don't go yet.
Rik Johnson.credits:
released June 8, 2022
All songs by Rik Johnson
tjm/r
